Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Huntington Bancshares Incorporated (HBAN) Sell-Side Analysis Report

## Company Overview
Huntington Bancshares Incorporated (NYSE: HBAN) is a diversified regional bank holding company headquartered in Columbus, Ohio, founded in 1866. It operates approximately 1,000 full-service branches and over 1,700 ATMs across 11 states, primarily in the Midwest and Great Lakes regions (Ohio, Michigan, Indiana, Illinois, Pennsylvania, Kentucky, West Virginia, Wisconsin, Minnesota, Colorado, and Florida). Huntington provides a wide range of banking, lending, wealth management, and investment services to consumer, small business, commercial, and municipal clients. Its business is segmented into four main areas: Consumer and Business Banking (retail deposits, mortgages, auto loans, small business lending); Commercial Banking (middle-market commercial loans, treasury management); Vehicle Finance (floorplan and lease financing for auto dealers); and Regional Banking/treasury. Huntington emphasizes customer-centric innovation, such as its "Asterisk" perks for checking accounts (free overdraft grace periods, early direct deposit) and digital tools like the Asterisk app. With total assets of ~$195 billion as of Q3 2024, it ranks among the top 15 U.S. banks by deposit market share in its footprint. The bank has grown through strategic acquisitions, including TCF Financial in 2021 (adding Minnesota/Wisconsin presence and $100B+ assets), and focuses on high-growth segments like auto finance and commercial lending amid a challenging rate environment. (187 words)

**Current Stock Metrics** (as of October 25, 2024, via Yahoo Finance):
| Metric          | Value          |
|-----------------|----------------|
| Stock Price     | $15.22        |
| Market Cap      | $21.95B       |
| 52-Week High    | $15.62        |
| 52-Week Low     | $11.13        |
| P/E Ratio (TTM) | 11.8          |
| Dividend Yield  | 4.4%          |

## Recent Developments
- **Q3 2024 Earnings (Released October 17, 2024)**: Reported EPS of $0.36 (beat estimates of $0.35); net interest income $1.15B (down 7% YoY due to higher deposit costs); provision for credit losses $143M (up from $98M YoY, driven by CRE office exposure); loans $116.3B (down 2% YoY); deposits $157.2B (down 3% YoY). CEO Steve Steinour highlighted stabilizing net interest margins at 2.99% and customer deposit growth momentum (Seeking Alpha transcript).
- **October 21, 2024**: Announced $700M share repurchase program authorization, signaling confidence in valuation (company press release).
- **September 2024**: Expanded small business lending program with $100M commitment to underserved communities via partnership with Local Initiatives Support Corporation (LISC).
- **July-August 2024**: Faced scrutiny in online discussions (Reddit r/stocks, Seeking Alpha forums) over CRE loan portfolio (~$14B, 12% of loans), with office loans at 22% criticized amid remote work trends; however, delinquency rates remain low at 0.4%.
- **June 2024**: Launched AI-powered fraud detection in mobile app, reducing false positives by 30% per internal claims.

## Growth Strategy
- **Organic + Inorganic Growth**: Focus on deposit share gains in core Midwest markets (targeting 1-2% annual growth); cross-selling via Asterisk ecosystem (38% household penetration).
- **Digital Transformation**: $500M+ tech investments (2023-2025) for AI/chatbot enhancements and 24/7 virtual assistant rollout (Q3 earnings call).
- **Segment Expansion**: Double auto finance (Huntington Vehicle Finance) to $20B by 2026; grow commercial & industrial (C&I) loans 5-7% annually targeting healthcare/manufacturing.
- **Capital Return**: 35-40% payout ratio; $1.2B dividends paid in 2023; ongoing buybacks.

## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds
| Category     | Headwinds                                                                 | Tailwinds                                                                 |
|--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Company** | CRE exposure ($14B, esp. office at $3.2B; provisions up 46% YoY Q3); deposit beta compression (funding costs at 2.5%); net interest margin squeeze to 2.99%. | Strong deposit franchise (top-3 in OH/MI/IN by share); low LTV on CRE (65%); ROCE 11.2% (Q3). |
| **Sector**  | Fed rate cuts (Sept 18, 2024: 50bps) risking NIM further; regulatory scrutiny on CRE (FDIC alerts Oct 2024); recession fears impacting loan demand. | Regional bank M&A wave (e.g., UMB-Heartland Oct 2024); deposit shift from money markets; election-year deregulation potential. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Consumer**: Checking/savings with Asterisk perks, mortgages ($15B portfolio), auto loans ($10B), credit cards.
- **Business**: SBA loans, treasury management, payroll services (1M+ small biz customers).
- **Commercial**: C&I loans ($50B), CRE ($14B), equipment finance.
- **Wealth**: $50B AUM via Huntington Private Bank; investment advisory.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Q4 2024 Rollout**: Enhanced "Asterisk for Business" with AI cash flow forecasting (pilot in Q3 showed 20% uptake).
- **2025 Pipeline**: Embedded finance APIs for fintech partners; sustainable lending products targeting ESG (announced Q3 call).
- **Vehicle Finance Expansion**: New EV floorplan lending program with GM/Ford dealers (launch Q1 2025).

## Market Share Approximations
- **Deposits**: ~8% in core 6-state footprint (OH/MI/IN/IL/Penn/KY); #2 in Ohio (12%), #3 in Michigan (10%) per S&P Global Market Intelligence (June 2024).
- **Loans**: 6-7% regional share; auto finance ~5% national dealer floorplan.
- **Small Business**: Top-10 nationally by SBA 7(a) loans issued (FY2023 FDIC data).

## Forecast of Growth/Decline in Market Share
- **Short-Term (2025)**: Flat to +1% deposit share gains via pricing/digital; loan share -1% due to selective CRE pullback.
- **Medium-Term (2026-2027)**: +2-3% growth via auto/C&I expansion and potential M&A; analysts (Goldman Sachs Oct 2024) project 4% EPS CAGR if rates stabilize.

## Comparison to Competitors
| Metric (Q3 2024) | HBAN       | KeyCorp (KEY) | Fifth Third (FITB) | PNC          |
|------------------|------------|---------------|--------------------|--------------|
| NIM              | 2.99%     | 2.85%        | 3.05%             | 2.92%       |
| Deposit Growth YoY | -3%      | -2%          | -1%               | -4%         |
| CET1 Ratio       | 10.2%     | 10.5%        | 10.8%             | 10.1%       |
| Market Cap       | $21.95B   | $15.2B       | $29.1B            | $73.5B      |
| **Edge**         | Deposit loyalty | Fee income  | Loan growth       | Scale       |

HBAN outperforms peers in customer retention (NPS 72 vs. sector 55) but lags in fee diversification.

## Partnerships, M&A
- **Partnerships**: Visa for small biz cards; Google Cloud for AI (2023); LISC for community lending (Sept 2024).
- **Recent M&A**: None in 2024; completed TCF integration (2021, $22B deal). Monitoring for bolt-ons in Southeast (CEO comments Q3 call).
- **Rumors**: Speculation on regional consolidation (e.g., with Wintrust; Barron's Oct 20, 2024).

## Current and Potential Major Clients
- **Current**: Auto dealers (10K+ via Vehicle Finance, e.g., Group 1 Automotive); healthcare (Cleveland Clinic, $2B+ exposure); manufacturers (e.g., Magna International).
- **Potential**: Fintechs for BaaS (banking-as-a-service) via new APIs; EV suppliers amid IRA subsidies; municipal bonds in expanding PA/FL footprints.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG**: B+ rating (Sustainalytics 2024); $2B sustainable finance commitment by 2025.
- **Management**: CEO Steinour (since 2009) praised for culture (Glassdoor 4.2/5); low turnover.
- **Risk Profile**: Diversified loan book (CRE 12%, consumer 25%); stress test pass (Fed June 2024).
- **Sentiment**: Bullish on X/Twitter (post-earnings); Seeking Alpha "Moderate Buy" consensus (target $16.50, Oct 25, 2024).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: 7/10 (Hold with upside potential). Strong deposit base and buybacks support stability; growth via auto/digital offsets CRE risks in moderate-risk portfolio.
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $17.50 (15% upside from $15.22). Based on 12x 2025E EPS ($1.45, per consensus) + 4.4% yield; DCF implies $18-19 assuming 3% GDP growth and Fed funds at 3.75% by YE2025.
